moves.1. e4: This is a wild game because white plays very sloppy in the beginning. However, White wins in a pretty queen sacrifice.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nc3 e5 3. f4: this is known as the vennia openning which is not very good for white. I choose to play it here because I wanted to do something different. In the past, I used to play this openning in tournaments and had good results against weaker opponents.
moves.3... d5: A great move that creates a vey dynamic centre.
moves.4. exd5 Nxd5 5. fxe5: a bad move that does not deal with black's major of ...Qh4. I needed to play Nf3
moves.5... Qh4+ 6. g3 Nxc3: ouch man I really needed the knight
moves.7. bxc3: as a general rule it is always better to capture toward the centre
moves.8... Qxh1 9. Nf3 Nc6 10. d4: defending e5 and freeing the dark bishop
moves.10... Bg4 11. Qe2 Bxf3 12. Qxf3 Qxh2+: This is where black goes off the tracks. Black should continue to trade peices, simplify the game and head into a favorable endgame. Instead he allows white to consolidate and retain an advantage of space which I take full advantage of.
moves.13. Bg2: Now black has run out of checks and his queen is out of position
moves.13... g6: ?? a massive blunder that loses because of white's superior mobilty better is:13. ...Be7 denying white the d8-h4 diagnonal
moves.14. Bg5: !! black's king is now stuck in the centre and white is suddenly winning
moves.14... Qh5: ?? Black is totaly oblivious to what is coming next.
moves.15. Qxc6+: Boom. And this bomb goes off in the black camp like a nuck. Black is left scratching his head and wondering what just happened
